title: Creates the crimes of criminal interference with a funeral service in the first and second degrees
summary: Creates the crimes of criminal interference with a funeral service in the first and second degrees; provides that criminal interference in the first degree be a class E felony and in the second degree to be a class A misdemeanor.

       AN ACT to amend the penal law, in relation to criminal interference with
         funeral services

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  The  section heading, subdivision 1 and the closing para-
    2  graph of section 240.70 of the penal law, as added by chapter 635 of the
    3  laws of 1999, are amended to read as follows:
    4    Criminal interference with health care services, FUNERAL SERVICES,  or
    5  religious worship in the second degree.
    6    1.  A  person is guilty of criminal interference with health services,
    7  FUNERAL SERVICES, or religious worship in the second degree when:
    8    (a) by force or threat of force or by physical obstruction, he or  she
    9  intentionally  injures,  intimidates  or interferes with, or attempts to
   10  injure, intimidate or interfere with, another person because such  other
   11  person was or is obtaining or providing reproductive health services; or
   12    (b)  by force or threat of force or by physical obstruction, he or she
   13  intentionally injures, intimidates or interferes with,  or  attempts  to
   14  injure,  intimidate  or  interfere  with,  another  person  in  order to
   15  discourage such other person or any other person or persons from obtain-
   16  ing or providing reproductive health services; or
   17    (c) by force or threat of force or by physical obstruction, he or  she
   18  intentionally  injures,  intimidates  or interferes with, or attempts to
   19  injure, intimidate or interfere with, another person because such person

    1  was or is seeking to exercise the right of religious freedom at a  place
    2  of religious worship; or
    3    (d)  he  or  she  intentionally  damages the property of a health care
    4  facility, or attempts to do so, because such facility provides reproduc-
    5  tive health services, or intentionally damages the property of  a  place
    6  of religious worship; OR
    7    (E)  WITH  INTENT  TO  PREVENT OR DISRUPT A FUNERAL OR BURIAL, FUNERAL
    8  HOME VIEWING OF A DECEASED PERSON, FUNERAL  PROCESSION,  OR  FUNERAL  OR
    9  MEMORIAL SERVICE FOR A DECEASED PERSON, WHEN HE OR SHE:
   10    (I)  BLOCKS,  IMPEDES,  INHIBITS,  OR IN ANY OTHER MANNER OBSTRUCTS OR
   11  INTERFERES WITH ACCESS INTO OR FROM ANY BUILDING OR  PARKING  LOT  OF  A
   12  BUILDING  IN WHICH A FUNERAL, WAKE, MEMORIAL SERVICE, OR BURIAL IS BEING
   13  CONDUCTED, OR ANY BURIAL PLOT OR THE PARKING  LOT  OF  THE  CEMETERY  IN
   14  WHICH  A  FUNERAL, WAKE, MEMORIAL SERVICE, OR BURIAL IS BEING CONDUCTED;
   15  OR
   16    (II) CONGREGATES, PICKETS OR DEMONSTRATES WITHIN THREE HUNDRED FEET OF
   17  AN EVENT SPECIFIED IN THIS SUBDIVISION; OR
   18    (III) WITHOUT AUTHORIZATION FROM THE FAMILY OF THE DECEASED OR  PERSON
   19  CONDUCTING  THE  SERVICE,  DURING  A FUNERAL, WAKE, MEMORIAL SERVICE, OR
   20  BURIAL:
   21    (1) SINGS, CHANTS, WHISTLES, SHOUTS, YELLS, OR USES A  BULLHORN,  AUTO
   22  HORN,  SOUND AMPLIFICATION EQUIPMENT, OR OTHER SOUNDS OR IMAGES OBSERVA-
   23  BLE TO OR WITHIN EARSHOT OF PARTICIPANTS IN THE FUNERAL, WAKE,  MEMORIAL
   24  SERVICE, OR BURIAL; OR
   25    (2)  DOES  OR  MAKES  ANY  UTTERANCE,  GESTURE, OR DISPLAY DESIGNED TO
   26  OUTRAGE THE SENSIBILITIES OF THE GROUP ATTENDING THE FUNERAL OR  BURIAL,
   27  FUNERAL HOME VIEWING OF A DECEASED PERSON, FUNERAL PROCESSION, OR FUNER-
   28  AL OR MEMORIAL SERVICE FOR A DECEASED PERSON; OR
   29    (3) DISTRIBUTES LITERATURE OR ANY OTHER ITEM.
   30    Criminal  interference with health care services, FUNERAL SERVICES, or
   31  religious worship in the second degree is a class A misdemeanor.
   32    S 2. Section 240.71 of the penal law, as amended by chapter 493 of the
   33  laws of 2009, is amended to read as follows:
   34  S 240.71  Criminal  interference  with  health  care  services,  FUNERAL
   35               SERVICES or religious worship in the first degree.
   36    A person is guilty of criminal interference with health care services,
   37  FUNERAL SERVICES or religious worship in the first degree when he or she
   38  commits  the crime of criminal interference with health care services or
   39  religious worship in the second degree and has been previously convicted
   40  of the crime of criminal interference with health care services, FUNERAL
   41  SERVICES or religious worship in the first or second  degree  or  aggra-
   42  vated  interference  with  health  care  services in the first or second
   43  degree.
   44    Criminal interference with health care services, FUNERAL  SERVICES  or
   45  religious worship in the first degree is a class E felony.
   46    S 3. This act shall take effect immediately.
